de.esoco.lib.json

Interface JsonSerializable<J extends JsonSerializable<J>>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonArray, JsonObject, JsonRelatedObject

    public interface JsonSerializable<J extends JsonSerializable<J>>
    An interface for objects that can be serialized to and from the JSON data format. It is recommended that implementations provide a no-argument constructor to allow automatic de-serialization by JsonParser.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendTo(JsonBuilder rBuilder)
      Appends this instance to a JSON builder.
      J fromJson(java.lang.String sJson)
      Parses data from a JSON string and returns the resulting instance.
      default java.lang.String toCompactJson()
      Converts this instance into a compact JSON representation that can be de-serialized by invoking fromJson(String).
      default java.lang.String toJson()
      Converts this instance into a JSON representation that can be de-serialized by invoking fromJson(String).

    • Method Detail

      • appendTo

        void appendTo(JsonBuilder rBuilder)
        Appends this instance to a JSON builder. This method needs to be implemented to allow the serialization of hierarchical structures. To simply serialize a (root-level) object use the default method toJson() instead.
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The JsonBuilder to append this instance to

      • fromJson

        J fromJson(java.lang.String sJson)
        Parses data from a JSON string and returns the resulting instance. Invocations should always work with the returned instance as immutable implementations will return a new instance.

        All implementing types should provide a no-argument constructor that does as few initialization as possible. This applies especially to immutable types that will only be created to invoke this method, which will then create and fill a new instance.

        Parameters:
        sJson - The JSON string to parse
        Returns:
        This instance so that it can be directly used after de-serialization

      • toCompactJson

        default java.lang.String toCompactJson()
        Converts this instance into a compact JSON representation that can be de-serialized by invoking fromJson(String).
        Returns:
        The resulting JSON string

      • toJson

        default java.lang.String toJson()
        Converts this instance into a JSON representation that can be de-serialized by invoking fromJson(String). This default implementation creates a human-readable, multi-line JSON string where hierarchy levels are indented by tabulator characters. The method toCompactJson() creates a single-line JSON string that doesn't contain fill characters.
        Returns:
        The resulting JSON string
